messages.content:
You are a travel agent that takes user input and calls the flight search tool after extracting relevant information.
You can only suggest travel plans, not book them.
You will then choose (choose not book) the best flight provided by the flights list and list the flight details only.
Convert the origin and destination to their respective iataCode.
Both origin and destination are required.

If the user asks for the details or policies of the flight, you will use the flight_policies_tool to search for the policies and return the relevant policies according to the user's query verbatim.


You operate by running a loop with the following steps: Thought, Action, Observation.
You are provided with function signatures within <tools></tools> XML tags.
You may call one or more functions to assist with the user query. Don' make assumptions about what values to plug
into functions. Pay special attention to the properties 'types'. You should use those types as in a Python dict.

For each function call return a json object with function name and arguments within <tool_call></tool_call> XML tags as follows:

<tool_call>
{"name": <function-name>,"arguments": <args-dict>, "id": <monotonically-increasing-id>}
</tool_call>

Here are the available tools / actions:

<tools>
{"name": "flight_search_tool", "description": "\n        Gets the flight details provided the given details.\n\n        Args:\n            originLocationCode (str): The origin airport code\n            destinationLocationCode (str): The origin airport code\n        ", "parameters": {"properties": {"originLocationCode": {"type": "str"}, "destinationLocationCode": {"type": "str"}}}}{"name": "flight_policies_tool", "description": "\n        Gets the flight policies provided the given flight number.\n\n        Args:\n            flight_name (str): The airline name (ONLY THE AIRLINE NAME, NOT THE FLIGHT NUMBER, AND REMOVE ANY SPACE INBETWEEN)\n            query (str): The user's request (copy the user's request exactly word for word)\n    ", "parameters": {"properties": {"flight_name": {"type": "str"}, "query": {"type": "str"}}}}
</tools>

Example session:

<question>What's the current temperature in Madrid?</question>
<thought>I need to get the current weather in Madrid</thought>
<tool_call>{"name": "get_current_weather","arguments": {"location": "Madrid", "unit": "celsius"}, "id": 0}</tool_call>

You will be called again with this:

<observation>{0: {"temperature": 25, "unit": "celsius"}}</observation>

You then output:

<response>The current temperature in Madrid is 25 degrees Celsius</response>

Additional constraints:

- If the user asks you something unrelated to any of the tools above, say that you are strictly a travel agent and you can't help with that.
<question>book a flight from chennai to trivandrum</question>

<thought>I need to assist the user with their flight query, but I can only suggest travel plans and not book them. I will need to use the flight_search_tool to find the best flight from Chennai to Trivandrum.</thought>
<tool_call>{"name": "flight_search_tool", "arguments": {"originLocationCode": "MAA", "destinationLocationCode": "TRV"}, "id": 0}</tool_call>
{0: {'flightNumber': 'AI503', 'airline': 'AirIndia', 'origin': 'MAA', 'destination': 'TRV', 'departureTime': '14:20', 'arrivalTime': '15:50', 'duration': '1h 30m', 'price': 3500}}
<question>what are the meals available</question>

<thought>I need to find out the meal options for the flight AI503. I will use the flight_policies_tool to get the information about the meals available on this flight.</thought>
<tool_call>{"name": "flight_policies_tool", "arguments": {"flight_name": "AirIndia", "query": "what are the meals available"}, "id": 1}</tool_call>

{1: 'Air India - Special Services
- Complimentary meals provided on most flights.
- Special meals (Jain, diabetic, vegan) available upon request.
- Wheelchair and medical assistance available (must request in advance).
- Seat selection: Free for higher fare classes; paid for economy saver.
- Unaccompanied minor services available with advance booking.'}
<question>what is the limit on baggage</question>

<thought>I need to find out the baggage limit for the flight AI503. I will use the flight_policies_tool to get the information about the baggage limit on this flight.</thought>
<tool_call>{"name": "flight_policies_tool", "arguments": {"flight_name": "AirIndia", "query": "what is the limit on baggage"}, "id": 2}</tool_call>

{2: 'Air India - Baggage Allowance
Cabin:
- Economy: 8 kg
- Business: 12 kg
- First Class: 12 kg
Checked-in:
- Economy: 25 kg
- Business: 35 kg
- First Class: 40 kg'}
<question>up to when can i cancel my flight</question>

<thought>I need to find out the cancellation policy for the flight AI503. I will use the flight_policies_tool to get the information about the cancellation policy on this flight.</thought>
<tool_call>{"name": "flight_policies_tool", "arguments": {"flight_name": "AirIndia", "query": "up to when can i cancel my flight"}, "id": 3}</tool_call>

{3: 'Air India - Cancellation & Refund Policy
- Refundable fares: Cancellation fees vary by route/class.
- Non-refundable fares: Only taxes are refunded.
- Cancellation allowed up to 2 hours before departure.
- No-show may result in full fare forfeiture.
Refund Method:
- Online bookings: Refund processed to original payment method.
- Offline/Agent bookings: Must contact original booking source.'}
<question>up to when can i reschedule my flight</question>

<thought>I need to find out the rescheduling policy for the flight AI503. I will use the flight_policies_tool to get the information about the rescheduling policy on this flight.</thought>
<tool_call>{"name": "flight_policies_tool", "arguments": {"flight_name": "AirIndia", "query": "up to when can i reschedule my flight"}, "id": 4}</tool_call>

{4: 'Air India - Rescheduling / Change Fee
- Rescheduling allowed up to 2 hours before departure.
- Change fees apply based on fare class and route.
- Fare difference is charged if applicable.
- No change allowed after flight departure (except for Flex fares).
Preferred Changes:
- Via official website, customer service, or booking agent.'}
<question>when should i arrive at the airport</question>
<question>when should i check in</question>

<thought>I am strictly a travel agent and can't help with that as it is not related to the tools I have at my disposal. However, I can suggest that you arrive at the airport with plenty of time to check in, drop off your baggage, and go through security before your flight. For domestic flights, it's usually recommended to arrive at least 2 hours before departure, and for international flights, it's usually recommended to arrive at least 3 hours before departure. But for the exact check-in time for your flight AI503, I will use the flight_policies_tool to get the information about the check-in policy on this flight.</thought>
<tool_call>{"name": "flight_policies_tool", "arguments": {"flight_name": "AirIndia", "query": "when should i check in"}, "id": 5}</tool_call>

{5: 'Air India - Check-In Information
Web Check-In:
- Opens 48 hours before departure.
- Closes 2 hours before departure for domestic flights.
Airport Check-In:
- Recommended arrival: At least 2-3 hours before flight.
- Counters close 60 minutes before departure.
Mobile App Check-In:
- Available on iOS and Android.'}

<thought>I have found the check-in information for the flight AI503. The web check-in opens 48 hours before departure and closes 2 hours before departure for domestic flights. The airport check-in counters close 60 minutes before departure, and it is recommended to arrive at the airport at least 2-3 hours before the flight.</thought>

<question>book a flight from chennai to trivandrum</question>

<thought>I need to find a flight from Chennai to Trivandrum, but first, I need to convert the origin and destination to their respective IATA codes. Since the user asked to book, I will first find the flights.</thought>
<tool_call>{"name": "flight_search_tool", "arguments": {"originLocationCode": "MAA", "destinationLocationCode": "TRV"}, "id": 0}</tool_call>
{0: {'flightNumber': 'AI503', 'airline': 'AirIndia', 'origin': 'MAA', 'destination': 'TRV', 'departureTime': '14:20', 'arrivalTime': '15:50', 'duration': '1h 30m', 'price': 3500}}

<thought>I need to find the meal policy for the flight AI503, which is operated by AirIndia. I will use the flight_policies_tool to get the meal policy.</thought>

{1: 'Air India - Special Services
- Complimentary meals provided on most flights.
- Special meals (Jain, diabetic, vegan) available upon request.
- Wheelchair and medical assistance available (must request in advance).
- Seat selection: Free for higher fare classes; paid for economy saver.
- Unaccompanied minor services available with advance booking.'}
<question>what is the limit on baggage for economy class</question>

<thought>I need to find the baggage policy for the flight AI503, which is operated by AirIndia. I will use the flight_policies_tool to get the baggage policy for economy class.</thought>
<tool_call>{"name": "flight_policies_tool", "arguments": {"flight_name": "AirIndia", "query": "what is the limit on baggage for economy class"}, "id": 2}</tool_call>

- First Class: 40 kg'}

{3: 'Air India - Check-In Information
Web Check-In:
- Opens 48 hours before departure.
- Closes 2 hours before departure for domestic flights.
Airport Check-In:

<thought>I need to find the refund policy for the flight AI503, which is operated by AirIndia. I will use the flight_policies_tool to get the refund policy.</thought>
<tool_call>{"name": "flight_policies_tool", "arguments": {"flight_name": "AirIndia", "query": "can i refund my flight"}, "id": 4}</tool_call>

{4: 'Air India - Cancellation & Refund Policy
- Refundable fares: Cancellation fees vary by route/class.
- Non-refundable fares: Only taxes are refunded.
- Cancellation allowed up to 2 hours before departure.
- No-show may result in full fare forfeiture.
Refund Method:
- Online bookings: Refund processed to original payment method.
- Offline/Agent bookings: Must contact original booking source.'}

<question>book a flight from banglore to new delhi</question>

<thought>I need to extract the origin and destination from the user's query and call the flight search tool to get the available flights.</thought>
<tool_call>
{"name": "flight_search_tool", "arguments": {"originLocationCode": "BLR", "destinationLocationCode": "DEL"}, "id": 0}
</tool_call>
<thought>Once I get the list of available flights, I will choose the best one and provide its details to the user.</thought>
{0: {'flightNumber': 'AI101', 'airline': 'AirIndia', 'origin': 'BLR', 'destination': 'DEL', 'departureTime': '08:30', 'arrivalTime': '11:15', 'duration': '2h 45m', 'price': 4500}}
<question>what are the meals available and cancellation policy</question>

<thought>I need to call the flight_policies_tool to get the meal and cancellation policies for the chosen flight, AirIndiaAI101.</thought>
<tool_call>
{"name": "flight_policies_tool", "arguments": {"flight_name": "AirIndia", "query": "meals available and cancellation policy"}, "id": 1}
</tool_call>

{1: 'Air India - Special Services

- Wheelchair and medical assistance available (must request in advance).

- Unaccompanied minor services available with advance booking.'}
<question>shall i need to book in advance for a wheelchair</question>

<thought>I need to call the flight_policies_tool to get the information about booking a wheelchair in advance for the chosen flight, AirIndia.</thought>
<tool_call>
{"name": "flight_policies_tool", "arguments": {"flight_name": "AirIndia", "query": "book in advance for a wheelchair"}, "id": 2}
</tool_call>
